Jason_Meadows:
{{short description|American singer-songwriter}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Jason Meadows | image = | caption = | image_size = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1971|06|09}} | origin = [[Calera, Oklahoma]] | instrument = [[Singing|Vocals]] | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer | years_active = 2007—present | label = Baccerstick | associated_acts = | website = }} '''Jason Meadows''' (born June 9, 1971) is a [[country music]] artist signed to Baccerstick Records. He was raised in [[Calera, Oklahoma]]. Meadows was a second-place finalist on the third season of the [[USA Networks]] talent show ''[[Nashville Star]]''.{{cite web|url=http://music.yahoo.com/ar-15601036-bio--Jason-Meadows |title=Jason Meadows biography |work=[[Yahoo! Music]] |accessdate=2008-12-31 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20050912053718/http://music.yahoo.com/ar-15601036-bio--Jason-Meadows |archivedate=2005-09-12 }} Three singles were released from his debut album ''100% Cowboy'' (the title track, "18 Video Tapes" and "Where Did My Dirt Road Go"), but all failed to chart.{{cite web|url=http://www.gactv.com/gac/ar_artists_a-z/article/0,,GAC_26071_5687179,00.html |archive-url=https://archive.today/20130124014442/http://www.gactv.com/gac/ar_artists_a-z/article/0,,GAC_26071_5687179,00.html |url-status=dead |archive-date=2013-01-24 |title=Artists A to Z: Jason Meadows biography |work=[[Great American Country]] |accessdate=2008-12-31 }} The album reached No. 59 on [[Top Country Albums]]. "18 Video Tapes" received a "thumbs up" rating from Engine 145, a country music review site. Reviewer Matt C. said, "Here’s a ''Nashville Star'' alumnus who didn’t score a major-label deal but nonetheless is producing interesting and compelling music."{{cite web|url=http://www.engine145.com/jason-meadows-18-video-tapes/ |title=Jason Meadows — "18 Video Tapes" |last=Matt C. |work=Engine 145 |accessdate=2008-12-31 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141218082533/http://www.engine145.com/jason-meadows-18-video-tapes/ |archivedate=2014-12-18 }} ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:10em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:16em;"| Album details ! colspan="2"| Peak chart
